nppez 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

nppez

Tidy NPPES NPI Registry Data Files

üì¶ Installation

You can install nppez from GitHub with:

# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("andrewallenbruce/northstar")

üî∞ Usage 

library(nppez)
library(fs)

test <- path(path_wd(), "inst/tmp")
dir_create(test)

Ask

List the most recent NPPES Data Dissemination releases

x <- nppez::ask(
  save = TRUE,
  path = test
)
#> Download Time: 0.34 sec elapsed

x
#> # A tibble: 5 √ó 4
#>   file                                                url     date          size
#>   <chr>                                               <chr>   <date>     <fs::b>
#> 1 "NPPES_Data_Dissemination_April_2024.zip"           https:‚Ä¶ 2024-04-08 941.55M
#> 2 "NPPES_Deactivated_NPI_Report_040824.zip"           https:‚Ä¶ 2024-04-08   1.98M
#> 3 "NPPES_Data_Dissemination_040124_040724_Weekly.zip" https:‚Ä¶ 2024-04-01   4.03M
#> 4 ""                                                  https:‚Ä¶ NA              NA
#> 5  <NA>                                               https:‚Ä¶ NA              NA

Grab

Download NPPES ZIP files to a local directory

y <- nppez::grab(
  obj   = x, 
  files = "NPPES_Data_Dissemination_030424_031024_Weekly.zip",
  path  = test
  )
#> Error in nppez::grab(obj = x, files = "NPPES_Data_Dissemination_030424_031024_Weekly.zip", : No `files` in results

y
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'y' not found

Peek 

nppez::peek(path = test)
#> Error in `dplyr::mutate()`:
#> ‚Ñπ In argument: `compressed = fs::fs_bytes(compressed_size)`.
#> Caused by error:
#> ! object 'compressed_size' not found

Prune 

nppez::prune(dir = "<path-to-downloaded-zip-files>")

Dispense 

nppez::dispense(from = "<path-to-downloaded-zip-files>",
                to = "<path-to-unzip-files-to>")
date size filename
2023-04-11 96.76M endpoint_pfile_20050523-20230409.csv
2023-04-12 330.03K endpoint_pfile_20230403-20230409.csv

Please note that the nppez project is released with a Contributor Code of Conduct. By contributing to this project, you agree to abide by its terms.

üèõÔ∏è Governance

This project is primarily maintained by Andrew Bruce. Other authors may occasionally assist with some of these duties.
